field_edited_text.value:
Inner Harbor, late 1950’s

Inner Harbor Management

Inner Harbor, 1984







INNER HARBOR

DEVELOPMENT EVENTS

1955 Greater Baltimore Committee formed

1956 Plan for Inner Harbor by Planning
Director McVoy published

1959 Urban Renewal Plan for Charles Center
announced and approved by City
Council.

1960 Charles Center Management Office
established

1963 Mayor McKeldin sets Inner Harbor

- redevelopment as a major objective for
the city

1964 First bond issue for $2,000,000 approved
for Inner Harbor

1965 Charles Center/Inner Harbor Manage-
ment, Inc. established

1966 Renewal planunveiled forInner Harbor
Project |. Voters approve loan for
$12,000,000.

1968 Inner Harbor project started with the
release of a $22.4 million Federal Grant.

1970 Metro Center plan for downtown
completed by Baltimore City Depart-
ment of Planning

1972 Constellation moved to permanent
berth at newly constructed Constellation
Pier.

1973 Dedication of John L. Deaton Medical
Nursing Center. First major new building
in Inner Harbor.

1973 4th Annual City Fair moved to Inner
Harbor site.

1974 First harbor tour service opened by
Baltimore Patriot at Constellation Dock.

1975 Shoreline promenade completed
around Inner Harbor

1976 Maryland Science Center opens

1976 Rash Athletic Field completed on south
shore of Inner Harbor

1976 Operation Sail: visit of Tall Ships to
Inner Harbor and Fells Point.

1977 World Trade Center completed

1978 Inner Harbor Marina opened on south
promenade

1978 Harborplace wins voter approval.

1979 “Top of The World” public observation
deck opened in World Trade Center.

1979 Baltimore Convention Center opens

1980 Harbqg-place opens

1981 National Aquarium in Baltimore opens

1981 Pier 6 Concert Pavillion completed

1981 Hyatt Hotel opens

1981 City Fair moved to Market-Place and
piers 5 & 6.

1982 Six Flags Corporation given right to
develop Pier 4 Power Plant.

1983 Rouse Co. announces plans for lot at
Pratt and Calvert. Development of a 500
room hotel, 1200 space parking garage,
office building and a 100,000 square foot
shopping gallery.

1984 Redevelopment of piers 5 & 6 begins

with reconstruction of bulkhead and fill.



Inner Harbor Management
